sense.gloss: festival (shrine visit) by children aged 7, 5 and 3

sdata.j: ↑今年↑↓ことし↓は↑娘↑↓むすめ↓の|↑七↑↓なな↓↑五↑↓ご↓↑三|↑↓さん↓だ。
sdata.e: Our daughter will be in the Shichi-Go-San festival this year.

sdata.j: ↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑子供↑↓こども↓たちが|↑七↑↓なな↓↑五↑↓ご↓↑三|↑↓さん↓の↑祝↑↓いわ↓いに↑着飾↑↓きかざ↓っていた。
sdata.e: Many children dressed up for the Shichigosan Festival.

sdata.j: |↑七↑↓なな↓↑五↑↓ご↓↑三|↑↓さん↓は↑11月↑↓じゅういちがつ↓15↑日↑↓にち↓です。↑男↑↓おとこ↓の↑子↑↓こ↓は3↑歳↑↓さい↓と5↑歳↑↓さい↓、↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓は3↑歳↑↓さい↓と7↑歳↑↓さい↓にあたるその↑祭↑↓まつ↓りに、↑子↑↓こ↓どもの↑成長↑↓せいちょう↓を↑祝↑↓いわ↓い、↑晴着↑↓はれぎ↓を↑着↑↓き↓せて↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓に↑詣↑↓まい↓る。
sdata.e: November 15th is the seven-five-three festival, when parents with boys of five, girls of seven and either boys or girls of three celebrate their children's maturation, dress them in gay clothes and take them to shrines where they pray for their children's future.
